intro: Astragalus glabristylus, commonly known as the smooth-styled milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. Astragalus glabristylus is also noted for its ecological importance, providing food for various pollinators and wildlife.
